# Xquik

> X (Twitter) real-time data platform. Real-time account monitoring, data extraction, giveaway draws, and a developer API with REST endpoints, HMAC webhooks, and an MCP server for AI agents.

Xquik tracks tweets, quotes, replies, retweets, and follower changes from monitored X accounts and delivers events via REST API polling, HMAC-signed webhooks, or an MCP server (Model Context Protocol) for AI agent integration. The platform provides 19 extraction tools for pulling replies, reposts, quotes, followers, following, verified followers, community members, community moderators, community posts, community search, list members, list posts, list followers, mentions, posts, threads, articles, Space participants, and people search results from any public account, tweet, list, community, or Space. It also offers giveaway draws with configurable filters and X data lookups (tweets, users, follower checks).

## Authentication

Two methods:

1. **API Key**: Format `xq_` + 64 hex characters. Pass via `x-api-key` header. Generate keys from the dashboard or `POST /api/v1/api-keys`.
2. **OAuth 2.1 Authorization Code with PKCE**: For browser-based MCP clients (Claude.ai, ChatGPT Developer Mode). Discovery at `https://xquik.com/.well-known/oauth-authorization-server`. Dynamic client registration at `https://xquik.com/api/oauth/register`.

## Base URLs

- REST API: `https://xquik.com/api/v1`
- MCP Server: `https://xquik.com/mcp` (StreamableHTTP transport, API key or OAuth Bearer token)

## Rate Limits

- API endpoints (`/api/v1/*`): 10 req/s sustained, 20 req/s burst
- General requests: 60 req/s, 100 req/s burst
- Exceeding limits returns `429 Too Many Requests` with `Retry-After` header

## Error Format

All errors return JSON:

```json
{ "error": "error_code" }
```

Some errors include additional context:

```json
{ "error": "monitor_limit_reached", "limit": 1 }
```

HTTP status codes: `400` (validation), `401` (unauthenticated), `402` (no subscription / usage cap), `403` (limit reached), `404` (not found), `409` (conflict), `429` (rate limited), `500` (server error), `502` (upstream unavailable).

Common error codes: `invalid_input`, `invalid_id`, `invalid_tweet_url`, `invalid_tweet_id`, `invalid_username`, `invalid_tool_type`, `invalid_format`, `missing_query`, `missing_params`, `unauthenticated`, `no_subscription`, `subscription_inactive`, `usage_limit_reached`, `monitor_limit_reached`, `not_found`, `monitor_already_exists`, `internal_error`, `stream_registration_failed`, `x_api_unavailable`.

Retry strategy: retry only on `429` and `5xx`. Formula: `delay = baseDelay * 2^attempt + random(0, jitter)`. Max 3 retries. Respect `Retry-After` header.

## Pagination

Cursor-based. Responses include `hasMore` (boolean) and `nextCursor` (opaque string). Pass `nextCursor` as the `after` query parameter on the next request. Do not decode or construct cursors manually. Used for events, draws, extractions. Monitors, webhooks, and API keys return up to 200 items without pagination.

## Event Types (6)

- `tweet.new` - Original tweet posted
- `tweet.quote` - Quote tweet posted
- `tweet.reply` - Reply posted
- `tweet.retweet` - Retweet posted
- `follower.gained` - New follower gained
- `follower.lost` - Follower lost

## Giveaway Draw Filters

`POST /api/v1/draws` accepts `tweetUrl` (required) plus these optional filters:

- `winnerCount` (number) - Winners to select (default 1)
- `backupCount` (number) - Backup winners to select
- `uniqueAuthorsOnly` (boolean) - One entry per author
- `mustRetweet` (boolean) - Require retweet of the original tweet
- `mustFollowUsername` (string) - Username entrants must follow
- `filterMinFollowers` (number) - Minimum follower count
- `filterAccountAgeDays` (number) - Minimum account age in days
- `filterLanguage` (string) - Language code filter (e.g., `en`, `tr`, `es`)
- `requiredKeywords` (string[]) - Keywords that must appear in reply text
- `requiredHashtags` (string[]) - Hashtags required in reply (with `#` prefix)
- `requiredMentions` (string[]) - Usernames that must be mentioned (with `@` prefix)

Tweet author is auto-excluded. Filters run before author deduplication. Winners selected via cryptographically secure randomness.

## X Search Syntax

The `q` parameter in `GET /api/v1/x/search-tweets` and `POST /api/v1/x/search-tweets` supports X search operators:

- `from:username` - Tweets by a specific user
- `to:username` - Tweets replying to a user
- `#hashtag` - Tweets containing a hashtag
- `"exact phrase"` - Exact phrase match
- `OR` - Boolean OR between terms
- `-exclude` - Exclude tweets matching a term

## Export

Draws and extractions support export via `GET /api/v1/draws/:id/export` and `GET /api/v1/extractions/:id/export`. Formats: `csv`, `xlsx`, `md` (Markdown). Query parameter: `format`. Extraction exports have a 50,000 row limit.

## Webhook Delivery

- Signature: HMAC-SHA256. Header: `X-Xquik-Signature: sha256=HMAC_HEX_DIGEST`. Secret returned once at webhook creation - store securely.
- Headers: `Content-Type: application/json`, `X-Xquik-Signature`
- Requirements: HTTPS endpoint, must respond `2xx` within 10 seconds
- Retry: Exponential backoff (1s, 2s, 4s, 8s, 16s). 5 attempts max. After all fail: status `exhausted`.
- Delivery statuses: `pending`, `delivered`, `failed`, `exhausted`

Webhook payload structure:

```json
{
  "eventType": "tweet.new",
  "username": "elonmusk",
  "data": { "tweetId": "1893456789012345678", "text": "...", "metrics": { "likes": 42000, "retweets": 8500, "replies": 3200 } }
}
```

Event data shapes vary by type: `tweet.new` includes `tweetId`, `text`, `metrics`. `tweet.quote` adds `quotedTweetId`, `quotedUsername`. `tweet.reply` adds `inReplyToTweetId`, `inReplyToUsername`. `tweet.retweet` includes `retweetedTweetId`, `retweetedUsername`. `follower.gained` and `follower.lost` include `followerId`, `followerUsername`, `followerName`, `followerFollowersCount`, `followerVerified`.

## Tweet Composition Workflow

Three-step workflow for algorithm-optimized tweets. All free, no subscription needed:

1. `compose-tweet` - Start composing. Returns X algorithm engagement signals and follow-up questions.
2. `refine-tweet` - After answering follow-ups. Returns goal-specific tips, example patterns, media strategy, hashtag advice, CTA guidance.
3. `score-tweet` - Evaluate a draft against X algorithm ranking factors. Returns pass/fail checklist.

Goals: `engagement`, `followers`, `authority`, `conversation`.

## MCP Tools (26 Total)

**Monitoring (3)** - free:
`list-monitors`, `add-monitor`, `remove-monitor`

**Events (2)** - free:
`get-events`, `get-event`

**X Data (4)** - metered:
`search-tweets`, `get-user-info`, `lookup-tweet`, `check-follow`

**Webhooks (4)** - free:
`list-webhooks`, `add-webhook`, `remove-webhook`, `test-webhook`

**Extractions (4)** - metered (run-extraction); free (list/get/estimate):
`run-extraction`, `list-extractions`, `get-extraction`, `estimate-extraction`

**Giveaway Draws (3)** - metered (run-draw); free (list/get):
`run-draw`, `list-draws`, `get-draw`

**Account & Trends (3)** - free:
`get-account`, `get-trends`, `subscribe`

**Tweet Composition (3)** - free:
`compose-tweet`, `refine-tweet`, `score-tweet`

## Extraction Tool Types (19)

By target type:

**Tweet target** (`targetTweetId`): `reply_extractor`, `repost_extractor`, `quote_extractor`, `thread_extractor`, `article_extractor`

**Username target** (`targetUsername`): `follower_explorer`, `following_explorer`, `verified_follower_explorer`, `mention_extractor`, `post_extractor`

**Community target** (`targetCommunityId`): `community_extractor`, `community_moderator_explorer`, `community_post_extractor`, `community_search` (also requires `searchQuery`)

**List target** (`targetListId`): `list_member_extractor`, `list_post_extractor`, `list_follower_explorer`

**Space target** (`targetSpaceId`): `space_explorer`

**Search** (`searchQuery`): `people_search`

Always call `estimate-extraction` before `run-extraction` to check cost and feasibility. Requires active subscription.

## Trending Regions (12)

| WOEID | Region |
|-------|--------|
| 1 | Worldwide |
| 23424977 | United States |
| 23424975 | United Kingdom |
| 23424969 | Turkey |
| 23424950 | Spain |
| 23424829 | Germany |
| 23424819 | France |
| 23424856 | Japan |
| 23424848 | India |
| 23424768 | Brazil |
| 23424775 | Canada |
| 23424900 | Mexico |

Trends cached, auto-refresh every 15 minutes. Free, no usage cost.

## Docs

- [Introduction](https://docs.xquik.com/introduction): Platform overview, capabilities, and integration methods.
- [Quickstart](https://docs.xquik.com/quickstart): Get your API key and make your first request in 2 minutes.
- [API Overview](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/overview): REST API v1 base URL, authentication, rate limits, and conventions.
- [Authentication](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/authentication): API key format, dual auth endpoints, key management, and security best practices.

## API Reference - Account & Keys

- [Get Account](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/account/get): Retrieve account info, subscription status, and current period usage.
- [Update Account](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/account/update): Update account locale preference (session auth only).
- [Create API Key](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/api-keys/create): Generate a new API key for programmatic access (session auth only).
- [List API Keys](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/api-keys/list): Retrieve all API keys with status and usage timestamps (session auth only).
- [Revoke API Key](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/api-keys/revoke): Permanently deactivate an API key. Immediate and irreversible.

## API Reference - Monitors

- [Create Monitor](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/monitors/create): Start monitoring an X account for real-time tweet events.
- [List Monitors](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/monitors/list): Retrieve all monitors for your account.
- [Get Monitor](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/monitors/get): Retrieve details for a specific monitor by ID.
- [Update Monitor](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/monitors/update): Change event types or toggle active status for a monitor.
- [Delete Monitor](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/monitors/delete): Remove a monitor and stop tracking the X account.

## API Reference - Events

- [List Events](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/events/list): Query events from monitored accounts with filtering and cursor-based pagination.
- [Get Event](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/events/get): Retrieve a single event by ID with full details.

## API Reference - Webhooks

- [Create Webhook](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/webhooks/create): Register an HTTPS endpoint to receive real-time event notifications.
- [List Webhooks](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/webhooks/list): Retrieve all webhook endpoints registered to your account.
- [Update Webhook](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/webhooks/update): Update the URL, event types, or active state of an existing webhook.
- [Delete Webhook](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/webhooks/delete): Deactivate a webhook endpoint and stop all future deliveries.
- [Test Webhook](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/webhooks/test): Send a test payload to verify a webhook endpoint. Free, no usage cost.
- [List Deliveries](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/webhooks/deliveries): View delivery attempts and their statuses for a specific webhook.

## API Reference - Draws

- [Create Draw](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/draws/create): Execute a giveaway draw on a tweet to select random winners.
- [List Draws](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/draws/list): Retrieve draw history with cursor-based pagination.
- [Get Draw](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/draws/get): Retrieve draw details including winners and tweet metadata.
- [Export Draw](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/draws/export): Export draw data as CSV, XLSX, or Markdown.

## API Reference - Extractions

- [Create Extraction](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/extractions/create): Run an extraction job using one of 19 tools (reply, repost, quote, follower, following, verified follower, community, community moderator, community post, community search, list member, list post, list follower, mention, people search, post, thread, article, Space).
- [List Extractions](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/extractions/list): Retrieve extraction job history with filtering and cursor-based pagination.
- [Get Extraction](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/extractions/get): Retrieve extraction job details with paginated results.
- [Export Extraction](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/extractions/export): Export extraction results as CSV, XLSX, or Markdown. 50,000 row limit.
- [Estimate Extraction](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/extractions/estimate): Get a cost estimate before running an extraction job.

## API Reference - X API

- [Get Tweet](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/x/get-tweet): Look up a single tweet with author information and optional attached media. Metered.
- [Search Tweets](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/x/search-tweets): Search tweets by query string with optional attached media. Metered.
- [Get User](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/x/get-user): Look up an X user profile by username. Metered.
- [Check Follower](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/x/check-follower): Check follow relationship between two X users. Metered.

## API Reference - Trends

- [List Trends](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/trends/list): Get trending topics by region. Free, no usage cost. 12 regions, cached, auto-refreshes every 15 minutes.

## Webhooks

- [Webhooks Overview](https://docs.xquik.com/webhooks/overview): Real-time event delivery to your HTTPS endpoints with HMAC-SHA256 signatures.
- [Signature Verification](https://docs.xquik.com/webhooks/verification): Verify HMAC-SHA256 signatures on incoming webhook deliveries.

## MCP Server

- [MCP Server Overview](https://docs.xquik.com/mcp/overview): Connect AI agents and IDEs (Claude Desktop, Claude Code, ChatGPT, Codex CLI, Cursor, VS Code, Windsurf, OpenCode) to Xquik via Model Context Protocol.
- [MCP Tools Reference](https://docs.xquik.com/mcp/tools): All 26 MCP tools with input/output schemas and usage examples. Includes tweet composition tools (compose-tweet, refine-tweet, score-tweet) for algorithm-optimized tweet drafting - free for all users.
- [Docs MCP Server](https://docs.xquik.com/mcp/docs-mcp): Search Xquik documentation from AI tools via a Mintlify-hosted MCP server at `https://docs.xquik.com/mcp`. No auth required. Separate from the API MCP server.

## OAuth

- [OAuth 2.1 (PKCE)](https://docs.xquik.com/oauth/overview): OAuth 2.1 Authorization Code flow with PKCE for MCP server authentication. Discovery endpoints, dynamic client registration, authorization, token exchange, refresh tokens.

## AI Agent Skill

- [Xquik Skill](https://github.com/Xquik-dev/x-twitter-scraper): AI agent skill that gives 40+ coding agents (Claude Code, Cursor, GitHub Copilot, Codex, Windsurf, VS Code, Gemini CLI, and more) deep knowledge of the Xquik API. Agents can write API integrations, set up webhook handlers with HMAC verification, configure MCP connections, and use all 19 extraction tools with correct parameters. Install via `npx skills add Xquik-dev/x-twitter-scraper`.

## Guides

- [Workflows](https://docs.xquik.com/guides/workflows): End-to-end integration patterns with complete code examples.
- [Error Handling](https://docs.xquik.com/guides/error-handling): Error recovery patterns, retry strategies, and rate limit handling.
- [Rate Limits](https://docs.xquik.com/guides/rate-limits): Rate limit tiers, burst allowances, and client-side rate limiting.
- [Webhook Testing](https://docs.xquik.com/guides/webhook-testing): Test webhook integrations locally with ngrok, RequestBin, and CLI tools.
- [Billing & Usage](https://docs.xquik.com/guides/billing): Subscription pricing, usage quotas, and monthly operation limits.
- [Trends](https://docs.xquik.com/guides/trends): Trending topics across 12 regions, caching behavior, and workflow examples combining trends with tweet search.
- [Extraction Workflow](https://docs.xquik.com/guides/extraction-workflow): End-to-end extraction guide. Estimate costs, run jobs, paginate results, and export files. All 19 tool types with code examples in 4 languages.

## Resources

- [Platform Architecture](https://docs.xquik.com/guides/architecture): Architecture overview, security model (API key auth, data isolation, authorization), rate limits, usage caps, monitoring architecture, and platform limitations.
- [Troubleshooting](https://docs.xquik.com/guides/troubleshooting): Common issues and solutions for the Xquik API.
- [Type Definitions](https://docs.xquik.com/guides/types): TypeScript type definitions for all API request and response objects.
